ShouldersCBBarBehindNeckPress.name: Cable Bar Behind Neck Press
ShouldersCBBarBehindNeckPress.preparation: Stand facing cable bar, mounted on each side to upper waist height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip upper chest height. Stand directly between both cable pulleys with one foot forward and other foot back. Push cable bar over head and position cable bar behind neck or rest on shoulders.
ShouldersCBBarBehindNeckPress.execution: Press cable bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return behind neck and repeat.
ShouldersCBBarBehindNeckPress.comments: Exercise may also be performed seated, straddling bench or on weight chair with back support.
ShouldersCBBarBehindNeckPress.synergists: supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, tricepsbrachii, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersCBBarMilitaryPress.name: Cable Bar Military Press
ShouldersCBBarMilitaryPress.preparation: Stand facing cable bar, mounted on each side to upper waist height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder width. Position cable bar upper chest height. Stand directly between both cable pulleys with one foot forward and other foot back.
ShouldersCBBarMilitaryPress.execution: Press cable bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
ShouldersCBBarMilitaryPress.comments: Feet may be positioned shoulder width apart or one foot in front of other with forward leg slightly bent (as shown). Upper chest assists (instead of side delts) since grip is slightly narrower and chest is high with low back arched back slightly.
ShouldersCBBarMilitaryPress.synergists: trapeziusmiddle, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersCBBarShoulderPress.name: Cable Bar Shoulder Press
ShouldersCBBarShoulderPress.preparation: Stand facing cable bar mounted on each side to upper waist height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip and position upper chest height. Stand directly between both cable pulleys with one foot forward and other foot back.
ShouldersCBBarShoulderPress.execution: Press cable bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
ShouldersCBBarShoulderPress.comments: Exercise may also be performed seated, straddling bench or on weight chair with back support. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
ShouldersCBBarShoulderPress.synergists: supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, tricepsbrachii, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersCBSeatedFrontRaise.name: Cable Seated Front Raise
ShouldersCBSeatedFrontRaise.preparation: Sit on seat above twin cable pulleys. Grasp stirrups on each side. Sit upright with arms straight down to each side with palms facing back.
ShouldersCBSeatedFrontRaise.execution: Raise stirrups forward and upward until upper arms are well above horizontal. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBSeatedFrontRaise.comments: Absolute height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

ShouldersCBAlternatingFrontRaise.name: Cable Alternating Front Raise
ShouldersCBAlternatingFrontRaise.preparation: Stand with low double pulleys behind. Grasp stirrup attachments, one in each hand. Stand away from pulley slightly with arms back somewhat at side and elbows straight or slightly bent.
ShouldersCBAlternatingFrontRaise.execution: Raise one stirrup forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat with opposite arm, alternating between arms.
ShouldersCBAlternatingFrontRaise.comments: Absolute height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

ShouldersCBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.name: Cable Alternating Seated Front Raise
ShouldersCBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.preparation: Sit on seat above twin cable pulleys. Grasp stirrups on each side. Sit upright with arms straight down to each side with palms facing back.
ShouldersCBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.execution: Raise one stirrup forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat with opposite arm. Continue by alternating raises between sides.
ShouldersCBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.comments: Absolute height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

ShouldersCBFrontRaise.name: Cable One Arm Front Raise
ShouldersCBFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp stirrup attachment. Stand away from pulley slightly with arm back somewhat at side and elbow straight or slightly bent.
ShouldersCBFrontRaise.execution: Raise stirrup forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat. Repeat with opposite arm.
ShouldersCBFrontRaise.comments: Absolute height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

ShouldersCBFrontRaiseRope.name: Cable One Arm Front Raise (with rope)
ShouldersCBFrontRaiseRope.preparation: Grasp end of Triceps Rope Cable attachment with one hand so that protruding end is in contact with side of hand (thumb and index finger). Stand away from pulley with arm back at side and elbow straight.
ShouldersCBFrontRaiseRope.execution: Raise stirrup forward and upward until arm is well above horizontal or cable makes contact with underside of upper arm. Lower and repeat. Repeat with opposite arm.
ShouldersCBFrontRaiseRope.comments: Absolute height of movement may depend on range of motion or when cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate.

ShouldersCBStandingShoulderPress.name: Cable Standing Shoulder Press
ShouldersCBStandingShoulderPress.preparation: Stand between two low to medium height pulleys. Grasp cable stirrups from each side. Position stirrups to each side of shoulders with elbows down to sides and stirrups above or slightly narrower than elbows.
ShouldersCBStandingShoulderPress.execution: Push stirrups upward until arms are extended overhead. Return stirrups to sides of shoulders and repeat.
ShouldersCBStandingShoulderPress.comments: Wrists maintain their approximate position above each elbow throughout movement. Feet may be positioned apart to each side or one foot back as shown. Cable pulleys should be much closer together than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.
ShouldersCBStandingShoulderPress.synergists: supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, tricepsbrachii, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersCBShoulderPress.name: Cable Shoulder Press
ShouldersCBShoulderPress.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrups from low to medium low position from each side. Position stirrups to each side of shoulders with elbows down to sides and stirrups above or slightly narrower than elbows.
ShouldersCBShoulderPress.execution: Push stirrups upward until arms are extended overhead. Return stirrups to sides of shoulders and repeat.
ShouldersCBShoulderPress.comments: Wrists maintain their approximate position above each elbow throughout movement.
ShouldersCBShoulderPress.synergists: supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, tricepsbrachii, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersCBTwistingOverheadPress.name: Cable Twisting Overhead Press
ShouldersCBTwistingOverheadPress.preparation: Stand beside low to medium height pulley. Grasp cable stirrup. Position stirrup to front of shoulder with elbow down to side. Place opposite hand on hip. With feet wide apart, squat down slightly.
ShouldersCBTwistingOverheadPress.execution: Rotate body away from pulley and straighten legs while pushing stirrup diagonally upward toward opposite side of body. Return to original position and repeat.
ShouldersCBTwistingOverheadPress.comments: Internal rotation of far hip (opposite side with resistance) is much greater than spinal rotation.
ShouldersCBTwistingOverheadPress.synergists: soleus, trapeziusmiddle, gluteusmaximus, deltoidlateral, adductors, trapeziuslower, quadriceps, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, tensorfasciaelatae, gluteusmedius, serratusanterior, iliopsoas, supraspinatus, quadratuslumborum, erectorspinae, obliques
